newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH COURT SUSPENDS DYCKERHOFF PLANT BUY.
newsitem.headline: POLISH COURT SUSPENDS DYCKERHOFF PLANT BUY.

text.p: A court in Warsaw has suspended for two weeks a sale of a 33-percent stake in Polish cement plant Malogoszcz SA to Germany's Dyckerhoff from the National Investment Fund No. 14 (NFI), the NFI spokeswoman said.

The court's decision on Firday followed France's Lafarge complaint that it had signed a tentative agreement to buy a Malogoszcz stake from NFI No. 14 before any Dyckerhoff purchase, Katarzyna Majchrzak said on Wednesday.

During the two weeks Lafarge -- which now has 41 percent in Malogoszcz, earlier bought from other NFIs and from the cement plant's employees, can sue NFI No. 14 in court for violating their agreement, she added.
"The court decided to suspend the sale of Malogoszcz for two weeks, but we are planning to appeal," Majchrzak told Reuters.
Dyckerhoff agreed to buy the Malogoszcz stake for $35 million.
Poland's NFI No. 14 is one of 15 such institutions created under Poland's mass privatisation scheme. Poles will get shares in the funds, which will be traded on the bourse.
Each fund holds strategic stakes in more than 30 companies and minority ones in the remaining nearly 500 companies earmarked from the programme.
